home.title: Home
home.document_description: Terraso is a set of free and powerful software tools to manage your landscape, protect your environment, and promote human livelihoods.

user.account_created_message: Your Terraso account has been created successfully with the following information. You can edit them any time.

group.default_content: Groups connect people with common interests and needs within and across landscapes.
group.form_new_description: Create a group to connect people with common interests and needs. Groups exist for people within and across landscapes.
group.list_description: A group can be an existing organization (like a landscape partnership or NGO) or any collection of people with a common interest.

landscape.form_email_info: This email address will be used by interested people to connect with you and your landscape.
landscape.form_edit_document_description: Edit the properties of the landscape “{{name}}”
landscape.boundaries_document_description: Updated the boundary of the “{{name}}” landscape
landscape.view_map_boundaries_help_details: Contact your landscape’s manager or <1>send us a message</1>.
landscape.form_boundary_options_description: <0><0>Select how you’d like to define where your landscape is.</0><1>We recommend updating the map regularly with the most accurate boundary of your landscape.</1><2>Don’t have a GeoJSON file? Create one.</2></0>
landscape.form_boundary_options_geojson: Upload a map file. <1>Accepted file formats: {{formats}}</1>
landscape.form_boundary_options_pin: Drop a pin on a map
landscape.form_boundary_pin_description: Search for the city or region your landscape is in. Then, move the pin to the center of the landscape.
landscape.list_map_help: <0>Can’t find your landscape on this map? <1>Add it to Terraso</1> or <3>learn more about landscapes</3>.</0>
landscape.form_boundary_draw_polygon_description: <0>Search for or zoom to your landscape. Use <1/> to change the background map. Use <3/> to start drawing.</0>
landscape.form_boundary_options_draw_polygon: Draw the landscape’s boundary on a map
landscape.form_boundary_draw_polygon_saved_create: Your landscape boundary is complete. Select <1/> to add more detail to your boundary or select Add Landscape to add your landscape to Terraso.
landscape.form_boundary_draw_polygon_saved_update: Your landscape boundary is complete. Select <1/> to add more detail to your boundary or select Update Map to submit your changes.
landscape.form_boundary_draw_polygon_edit_help: How to edit: Drag points to adjust the shape. Select points to remove. When you are finished, save and select {{saveLabel}}.
landscape.profile_profile_card_empty: No information about this landscape’s people and livelihoods is available.
landscape.profile_profile_card_enter: Provide details about the people within your landscape and their livelihoods.
landscape.form_profile_description: Describe the people within your landscape and their livelihoods. (This step is optional.)
landscape.form_profile_languages_placeholder: Select one or more spoken languages
landscape.form_profile_commondities_placeholder: Select one or more products or commodities
landscape.form_profile_partnership_status: Is a landscape partnership managing this landscape?
landscape.profile_affiliation_card_empty: No partnerships or affilations have been established.
landscape.form_profile_organizations: Other active organizations in the landscape
landscape.form_affiliation_description: Select the landscape partnership and other institutions or organizations active in your landscape. (This step is optional.)
landscape.form_development_goals_description: Describe the goals of your landscape, the challenges and opportunities a landscape partnership will face, and the strategy you will follow.
landscape.form_development_goals_placeholder: Describe the sustainable development goals of your landscape.
landscape.form_development_problem_situtation_plac: Describe the challenges of the landscape in achieving its goals.
landscape.form_development_intervention_strategy_p: Describe what your landscape partnership is doing to respond to the challenges and opportunities.
landscape.profile_development_card_empty: Develop your landscape’s goals collaboratively and add to your landscape. <1>Learn more about the shared vision and strategy</1>.
landscape.form_key_info.name: name
landscape.form_profile_image_description_placehold: Describe the photo. This helps people who cannot see the image.
landscape.form_profile_image_file_no_accepted: Upload images with one of the following extensions: {{extensions}}
landscape.form_profile_profile_image_success: Your landscape profile photo has been updated.
landscape.profile_profile_card_profile_image_place: Upload an image of your landscape.
landscape.form_development_problem_situtation_help: Examples of challenges include deforestation, poverty, lack of economic opportunities and funding. <1>Learn more about assessment of landscape challenges</1>.
landscape.form_development_intervention_strategy_h: <0>Examples include convening landscape partners to identify  solutions, conducting policy campaigns and building capacity of stakeholders.</0> <1>Learn more about <0>landscape action plan</0> and <1>finance strategy</1>.</1>
landscape.form_development_goals_helper_text: Examples of sustainable development goals include: <1><0>Conserve and restore biodiversity</0><1>Improve crop and livestock yields sustainably</1><2>Achieve food and livelihood security</2><3>Strengthen access to health, education and other human services</3><4>Enhance social capital and social equity</4></1> <2>Learn more about vision and planning.</2>
landscape.form_development_opportunities_placehold: Describe the opportunities of the landscape which will help the partnership to achieve its goals.
landscape.form_development_opportunities_helper_te: Examples of opportunities include rich biodiversity, engaged community members and geographic location. <1>Learn more about assessment of landscape opportunities</1>.
landscape.form_profile_commondities_helper_text: What are the main agricultural products and commodities produced in your landscape?
landscape.form_profile_livelihoods_helper_text: What are the main occupations and sources of employment in your landscape?
landscape.form_profile_population_helper_text: Roughly, how many people live in this landscape?
landscape.form_profile_languages_helper_text: Which languages are spoken in your landscape? Include minority languages.
landscape.form_profile_organizations_helper_text: List institutions contributing to your landscape’s development. These may include government agencies, non-government organizations, educational institutions, religious organizations and businesses.
landscape.form_profile_affiliated_groups_helper_te: Which Terraso groups operate in your landscape?
landscape.form_profile_partnership_group_helper_te: Select a Terraso group that represents your landscape partnership
landscape.form_profile_partnership_year_helper_tex: Approximately when did stakeholders start collaborating?
landscape.form_profile_partnership_status_helper_t: A landscape partnership is a group of organizations working together for the future of the landscape.
landscape.form_email_helper_text: This will be displayed as a primary contact.
landscape.form_name_helper_text: Your landscape’s formal or common name.
landscape.form_profile_image_description_helper_te: Describe your landscape profile image in a couple of sentences
landscape.form_profile_profile_image_helper_text: Upload a high-resolution image to represent your landscape
landscape.form_profile_area_types_helper_text_rura: Rural areas are usually located far from cities and urban areas and generally have limited services and infrastructure. Most people live or work on farms in villages, towns and other larger settlements. Land is used primarily for agriculture, pasture, forestry and conservation of natural areas.
landscape.form_profile_area_types_helper_text_peri: Peri-urban are areas of transition between rural and urban land, usually located at the perimeter, or outer limits, of urban centers. They include a mix of characteristics of urban and rural areas.
landscape.form_profile_area_types_helper_text_urba: Urban areas usually refer to cities, suburbs and towns. They have high population density, infrastructure (eg. water and sewage) and connectivity (like airports, ports, railways, large buildings, housing and roads). Land use is primarily residential, with some commercial and industrial use.
landscape.form_profile_ecosystem_types_helper_text:
Deserts: Excessive temperature and extreme sunshine, barren land with little precipitation, hostile living conditions for plant and animal life

Temperate Forest: Found near the cooler coastal areas further north or south of the equator

Tropical Forest: Found closer to the equator where it is warm. Hot and moist biome, rains all year long

Marine/coastal: Area on the shore, may be composed of coastline, rocks, sea cliffs, offshore islands, dunes, marine or freshwater lakes

Polar/Alpine: Cliffs, talus fields, boulder fields and rock glaciers; permanent and persistent snow and icefields, including glaciers; and various water bodies

Savannas: Grassland with scattered trees

Shrublands: Woody or herbaceous shrubs and trees

Wetlands: Covered or saturated with water, often groundwater, seeping up from an aquifer or spring. Includes peatlands, marshes, and bogs. Water may be temporary or permanent.
landscape.form_profile_agricultural_production_met: Which agricultural production methods do you use in your landscape?

sharedData.title: Shared files and Links
sharedData.description_with_files: Only members of your {{entityType}} can download these files or create a map with them.

Read more about how to <1>prepare your data file for mapping</1>.</2>
